To the chief Musician, <FI>A Psalm<Fi> of David, the servant of the LORD, who spake unto the LORD the words of this song in the day <FI>that<Fi> the LORD delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul: And he said, I will love thee, O LORD, my strength.

The LORD <FI>is<Fi> my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, <FI>and<Fi> my high tower.<RF>my strength: Heb. my rock<Rf>
I will call upon the LORD, <FI>who is worthy<Fi> to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.
The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of ungodly men made me afraid.<RF>ungodly men: Heb. Belial<Rf>
The sorrows of hell compassed me about: the snares of death prevented me.<RF>sorrows: or, cords<Rf>
In my distress I called upon the LORD, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, <FI>even<Fi> into his ears.
Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the hills moved and were shaken, because he was wroth.
There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.<RF>out of his nostrils: Heb. by his, etc<Rf>
He bowed the heavens also, and came down: and darkness <FI>was<Fi> under his feet.
And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: yea, he did fly upon the wings of the wind.
He made darkness his secret place; his pavilion round about him <FI>were<Fi> dark waters <FI>and<Fi> thick clouds of the skies.
At the brightness <FI>that was<Fi> before him his thick clouds passed, hail <FI>stones<Fi> and coals of fire.
The LORD also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice; hail <FI>stones<Fi> and coals of fire.
Yea, he sent out his arrows, and scattered them; and he shot out lightnings, and discomfited them.
Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.
He sent from above, he took me, he drew me out of many waters.<RF>many: or, great<Rf>
He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them which hated me: for they were too strong for me.
They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the LORD was my stay.
He brought me forth also into a large place; he delivered me, because he delighted in me.<CM>
The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.
For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not wickedly departed from my God.
For all his judgments <FI>were<Fi> before me, and I did not put away his statutes from me.
I was also upright before him, and I kept myself from mine iniquity.<RF>before: Heb. with<Rf>
Therefore hath the LORD recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.<RF>in…: Heb. before his eyes<Rf>
With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful; with an upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright;
With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself froward.<RF>shew thyself froward: or, wrestle<Rf>
For thou wilt save the afflicted people; but wilt bring down high looks.
For thou wilt light my candle: the LORD my God will enlighten my darkness.<RF>candle: or, lamp<Rf><CM>
For by thee I have run through a troop; and by my God have I leaped over a wall.<RF>run…: or, broken<Rf>
<FI>As for<Fi> God, his way <FI>is<Fi> perfect: the word of the LORD is tried: he <FI>is<Fi> a buckler to all those that trust in him.<RF>tried: or, refined<Rf>
For who <FI>is<Fi> God save the LORD? or who <FI>is<Fi> a rock save our God?
<FI>It is<Fi> God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.
He maketh my feet like hinds' <FI>feet<Fi>, and setteth me upon my high places.
He teacheth my hands to war, so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.
Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy right hand hath holden me up, and thy gentleness hath made me great.<RF>thy gentleness…: or, with thy meekness thou hast multiplied me<Rf>
Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, that my feet did not slip.<RF>my feet: Heb. mine ankles<Rf>
I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them: neither did I turn again till they were consumed.
I have wounded them that they were not able to rise: they are fallen under my feet.
For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle: thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.<RF>subdued: Heb. caused to bow<Rf>
Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies; that I might destroy them that hate me.
They cried, but <FI>there was<Fi> none to save <FI>them: even<Fi> unto the LORD, but he answered them not.
Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind: I did cast them out as the dirt in the streets.
Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; <FI>and<Fi> thou hast made me the head of the heathen: a people <FI>whom<Fi> I have not known shall serve me.

As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me: the strangers shall submit themselves unto me.<RF>As soon…: Heb. At the hearing of the ear<Rf><RF>submit…: or, yield feigned obedience<Rf><RF>strangers: Heb. sons of the stranger<Rf>
The strangers shall fade away, and be afraid out of their close places.<RF>strangers: Heb. sons of the stranger<Rf>
The LORD liveth; and blessed <FI>be<Fi> my rock; and let the God of my salvation be exalted.
<FI>It is<Fi> God that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under me.<RF>avengeth: Heb. giveth avengements for<Rf><RF>subdueth: or, destroyeth<Rf>
He delivereth me from mine enemies: yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.<RF>violent…: Heb. man of violence<Rf>
Therefore will I give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the heathen, and sing praises unto thy name.<RF>give…: or, confess<Rf>
Great deliverance giveth he to his king; and sheweth mercy to his anointed, to David, and to his seed for evermore.<CM>
